listitem.para: Enhance API with latest architecture changes
Fix specification according to remarks from Dmitry Teselkin
ASP.NET Application, Web Server Farm and ASP.NET Application Farm Services Added, uri/address/endpoint corrections, hostname assignment section added

section.title: Introduction
section.para: Murano Service API is a programmatic interface used for interaction with Murano. Other interaction mechanisms like Murano Dashboard or Murano CLI should use API as underlying protocol for interaction.

glossary.para: For detailed information about entities and terms used in this document, please refer first to architecture.

glossdef.para: Environment is a set of logically related Services managed by a single tenant. Environment defines Windows environment boundaries.

Services within single Environment may comprise some complex configuration while Services in different Environments are always independent from one another. Each Environment is associated with single OpenStack project (tenant).

Service is building block of Windows environment. Service is a set of one or more Virtual Machines sharing a common purpose and configured together. Each service belongs to a single Environment and single Service Type.
Services are comprised from one or more Service Units.
Service type is definition for describing set of features exposed by service.
Service Units are the actual Windows Server VMs instantiated by OpenStack and then configured according to its Service Type (this may also correspond to one of predefined Windows Server roles).

Service Metadata is a JSON-encoded definition of Environment, its Services and their Service Units along with all their attributes. Service Metadata may describe both current and the intended state of the Environment.
All changes to environment done in scope of Session. After all changes to Environment state are accumulated, changes actually are applied only after session is deployed.

section.title: Return codes and errors
section.para: All REST API calls return the natural HTTP response codes for the operations, e.g. a successful GET returns a HTTP 200, a successful PUT returns a HTTP 201, a GET for a non-existent entity returns HTTP 404, unauthorized operations return HTTP 401 or HTTP 403, internal errors return HTTP 500.

section.title: Response of POSTs and PUTs
section.para: All POST and PUT requests by convention should return the created object (in the case of POST, with a generated ID) as if it was requested by GET.

section.title: Authentication
section.para: All requests include a Keystone authentication token header (X-Auth-Token). Clients must authenticate with Keystone before interacting with the Murano service.

section.title: Workflow
section.para:
Let’s review a sample workflow (series of API calls) for creating new Environment with Active Directory Service deployment:
POST /environments/ - Creating new Environment
POST /environments/id/configure – Creating new configuration session for Environment
POST /environments/id/services – Creating new ActiveDirectory service
POST /environments/id/sessions/session_id/deploy – Saving and deploying changes

section.title: Hostname assignment
section.para: Each Service Object definition may have an attribute "unitNamingPattern" that is used to control hostnames that will be assigned to spawned VM instances of the service.

Hostname pattern has the form of "name#" where "#" character is replaced with sequential number of unit within the service (starting with 1) and all other characters remain intact. For example Service with unitNamingPatter equal to "ad#-loc" will have units with hostnames "ad1-loc", "ad2-loc" etc.
"unitNamingPattern" attribute is optional. If it is omitted then a unique random hostname would be assigned.

section.title: Environment API
section.para: This section describes API calls for Environment management.

section.title: Get a List of existing Environments

row.entry: Creation date and time in ISO format
Modification date and time in ISO format
Get a list of existing Environments

section.title: Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns
section.para:
This call returns list of environments. Only the basic properties are returned. For details see "Get Environment Instance Detailed Information":
{ "environments": [ { "id": "0ce373a477f211e187a55404a662f968", "name": "dc1", "created": "2010-11-30T03:23:42Z", "updated": "2010-11-30T03:23:44Z", "tenant_id": "0849006f7ce94961b3aab4e46d6f229a", "version": 1, "status": "ready" }, { "id": "c697bd2429304820a928d145aa42af59", "name": "dc2", "created": "2010-11-30T03:23:42Z", "updated": "2010-11-30T03:23:44Z", "tenant_id": "0849006f7ce94961b3aab4e46d6f229a", "version": 2, "status": "deploying" } ] }

section.title: Returns
section.para:
This call returns created environment:
{ "id": "ce373a477f211e187a55404a662f968", "name": "env1", "created": "2010-11-30T03:23:42Z", "updated": "2010-11-30T03:23:44Z", "tenant_id": "0849006f7ce94961b3aab4e46d6f229a", "version": 0 }

row.entry: User is not authorized to access this tenant resources

section.title: Returns
section.para:
This call returns modified environment object:
{ "id": "ce373a477f211e187a55404a662f968", "name": "env1-changed", "created": "2010-11-30T03:23:42Z", "updated": "2010-11-30T03:23:44Z", "tenant_id": "0849006f7ce94961b3aab4e46d6f229a", "version": 0 }

row.entry: Returns detailed information about Environment including child entities
User is not authorized to access this tenant resources

section.title: Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns

row.entry: User is not authorized to access this tenant resources

section.title: Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns
section.para: None

section.title: Environment Configuration API
section.para: Multiple sessions could be opened for one environment simultaneously, but only one session going to be deployed. First session that starts deploying is going to be deployed; other ones become invalid and could not be deployed at all. User could not open new session for environment that in `deploying` state (that’s why we call it “almost lock free” model).

row.entry: Environment that going to be modified during this session
Creation date and time in ISO format
Modification date and time in ISO format
Environment version for which configuration session is opened
Session state. Could be: open, deploying, deployed

section.title: Configure Environment / Open session
section.para: During this call new working session is created, and session ID should be sent in header (X-Configuration-Session) to all next API calls.

row.entry: Could not open session for environment, environment has deploying status

section.title: Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns
section.para:
This call returns created session:
{ "id": "4aecdc2178b9430cbbb8db44fb7ac384", "environment_id": "4dc8a2e8986fa8fa5bf24dc8a2e8986fa8", "created": "2010-11-30T03:23:42Z", "updated": "2010-11-30T03:23:54Z", "user_id": "d7b501094caf4daab08469663a9e1a2b", "version": 12, "state": "open" }

row.entry: Deploying changes made in session with specified <sessionId>
Session is already deployed or deployment is in progress

section.title: Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns
section.para: None

row.entry: Getting details about session with specified <sessionId>
User is not authorized to access this session

section.title: Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns
section.para:
This call returns session information:
{ "id": "4aecdc2178b9430cbbb8db44fb7ac384", "environment_id": "4dc8a2e8986fa8fa5bf24dc8a2e8986fa8", "created": "2010-11-30T03:23:42Z", "updated": "2010-11-30T03:23:54Z", "user_id": "d7b501094caf4daab08469663a9e1a2b", "version": 0, "state": "deploying" }

row.entry: User is not authorized to access this session
Session is in deploying state and could not be deleted

section.title: Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns
section.para: None

section.title: Services API
section.para: This section describes API calls for managing all types of services.

section.title: GET
section.para:
Using GET calls to services endpoint user works with list containing all services for specified environment. User can request whole list, specific service, or specific attribute of specific service using tree traversing.
To request specific service user should add to endpoint part with service id, e.g.: /environments/<id>/services/<service_id>. For selection of specific attribute on service, simply appending part with attribute name will work. For example to request service name, user should use next endpoint: /environments/<id>/services/<service_id>/name

section.title: Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns
section.para: Json Object

section.title: PUT
section.para: Using PUT calls user can update or add any attribute on any service.

section.title: Payload
section.para: Json Object

section.title: Returns
section.para: Json Object

section.title: POST
section.para: POST calls used for adding new elements to lists with objectes.

section.title: Payload
section.para: Json Object

section.title: Returns
section.para: Json Object

section.title: DELETE
section.para: User can remove any attribute or list item using DELETE calls.

section.title: Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns
section.para: None

section.title: Example Calls using Web Server as example
section.para: Please use this example for constructing general CRUD calls to services.

section.title: Get a List of existing services

row.entry: Get a list of existing WebServers

section.title: Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns
section.para:
This call returns list of services:
[ { "id": "0ce373a477f211e187a55404a662f968", "name": "frontend", "type": "webServer". "created": "2010-11-30T03:23:42Z", "updated": "2010-11-30T03:23:44Z", "domain": "ACME", "uri": "http://10.0.0.2", "units": [{ "id": "1bf3491c409b4541b6f18ea5988a6437", "address": "10.0.0.2", "location": "west-dc" }] }, { "id": "c697bd2429304820a928d145aa42af59", "name": "backend", "type": "webServer". "created": "2010-11-30T03:23:42Z", "updated": "2010-11-30T03:23:44Z", "domain": "ACME", "uri": "http://10.0.0.3", "units": [{ "id": "eb32f97866d24001baa430cb34e4049f", "address": "10.0.0.3", "location": "west-dc" }] }

section.title: Returns
Payload
section.para: None

section.title: Returns
section.para: None
